intro: Doria miser, commonly known as the sad doria, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery down. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is highly sensitive to changes in temperature and humidity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Doria miser is considered a species of conservation concern.
